Documentation for the Code¶

pydygp - a python package for dynamic systems with latent Gaussian processes

kernel objects

class pydygp.kernels.Kernel(kfunc, kpar, **kwargs)[source]¶

Note

An example of intersphinx is this: you cannot use pickle on this class.

classmethod SquareExponKernel(kpar=None, dim=1)[source]¶

Create a square exponential kernel

\[x^2 + y^2 = z^2\]
(1)¶\[p(x) = \prod_{k=1}^{K}\exp\left\{-\frac{1}{2} \mathbf{x}^T\mathbf{C}_{xx}^{-1}\mathbf{x} - \frac{1}{2}(\mathbf{f}_k-\mathbf{M}_k\mathbf{x}_k)\mathbf{S}_k^{-1}(\mathbf{f_k}-\mathbf{M}_k\mathbf{x}_k) \right\}\]
class pydygp.linlatentforcemodels.MLFM_MH_AdapGrad(structure_matrices)[source]¶

This class does something related to this equation

\[p(x) = ?\]

default initalisation requires only the specification of the structure matrices \(\mathbf{A}_{r}\) which make up the evolution equation

\[\dot{x}(t) = \left( A_0 + \sum_{r=1}^{R} g_r(t) A_r \right) x(t)\]

Read more in the User guide.

Utility functions

Utility function which gets called to return the matrices \(\mathbf{A}, \mathbf{B}, \mathbf{C}\) in equation (1)

I return some values from (1)

Parameters:
  • tt – array of input times
  • kern – kernel object
  • kpar – option parameters for the kernel
